import React, { useState } from 'react'; import Layout from '../components/Layout'; import Card from '../components/ui/Card'; import Input from '../components/ui/Input'; import Select from '../components/ui/Select'; import Button from '../components/ui/Button'; const JobsPage = () => { const [jobs] = useState([ { id: 1, title: 'Software Engineer', company: 'Tech Co', location: 'San Francisco, CA', type: 'Full-time', salary: '$100,000 - $150,000' }, { id: 2, title: 'Product Manager', company: 'Startup Inc', location: 'New York, NY', type: 'Full-time', salary: '$120,000 - $180,000' }, { id: 3, title: 'Data Scientist', company: 'Big Data Corp', location: 'Seattle, WA', type: 'Contract', salary: '$80,000 - $120,000' }, { id: 4, title: 'UX Designer', company: 'Creative Agency', location: 'Los Angeles, CA', type: 'Part-time', salary: '$60,000 - $90,000' }, { id: 5, title: 'Marketing Specialist', company: 'E-commerce Giant', location: 'Chicago, IL', type: 'Full-time', salary: '$70,000 - $100,000' }, ]); return (

Available Jobs

Filters
{jobs.map((job) => (

{job.title}

{job.company} • {job.location}

{job.type} • {job.salary}

))}
); }; export default JobsPage;
